entry.title: Batch process positive patterns
entry.content:
Currently, each regex is a giant OR of regexes for every language. With

PatternProvider, a single regex per language is used instead.

Unfortunately, it turns out that calling the regex engine with one

larger regex is faster than multiple smaller regexes.



To improve the PatternProvider performance, this CL thus concatenates

the smaller regexes at runtime* to again just make a single call.



This is complicated by the fact that the regex matching logic also

depends on the MatchAttribute of the regex, describing whether it should

apply label, name, etc. of the field. For this reason, the CL batches

regexes by their set of MatchAttribute, before joining them and calling

the regex engine.



This improves the runtime of the go/heuristic-classification-tests on my

cloudtop from ~18 secs to ~12 seconds (without pattern provider it takes

~9 seconds). The fact that the output doesn't change also serves as an

additional test that this change is correct.



* This can't be done at compile time, since we only consider a subset

of regexes, depending on the page language.



Bug: 1479353

Change-Id: I33e2d73135460d755cdd065cf1fb1902d65483c9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5206610

entry.title: [bookmarks] Instantiate BookmarkLoadDetails on backend sequence
entry.content:
Refactoring without behavioral differences to simplify the

BookmarkLoadDetails' lifetime. It is now created on the backend sequence

and considered an output-only parameter (or return value) in

ModelLoader.



The change also avoids dependencies to BookmarkClient from

BookmarkLoadDetails, previously only needed to load the managed node

(in particular after the recent refactoring in

https://crrev.com/c/5222381). Loading of the managed node is now moved

to ModelLoader, to avoid plumbing overhead.

entry.content:
This change introduces the main DockingPromoCoordinator scaffolding.



It introduces:



1. DockingPromoCommands, which tell DockingPromoCoordinator to display

the Docking Promo via a UI command.



2. DockingPromoDisplayHandler, a custom Promos Manager display handler,

which invokes the DockingPromoCommands handler.



3. Conditional start of DockingPromoCoordinator in BrowserCoordinator.



4. Including the new DockingPromoDisplayHandler in

PromosManagerCoordinator.

entry.title: [Fuzzing] Prefer OWNERS files over git blame.
entry.content:
gen_fuzzer_owners.py is used to generate a FOO.owners file for every

fuzzer executable FOO we build (in a certain configuration).



The historical approach ever since crrev.com/c/1028668 was to use

`git blame` to find "the author of FOO" and save that to FOO.owners.



For code in `third_party` (git submodules), a simple `git blame`

invocation from `chromium/src` does not work. Instead, the nearest

OWNERS file is located instead. This behavior was introduced in

crrev.com/c/3039004.



This CL aims to use the second approach (locate OWNERS file) for all

code by default, falling back to `git blame` only in case of failure.



Why? The chromium repo has grown such that running `git blame` for every

single fuzzer is very slow. The hope is that finding OWNERS files is

much faster, as well as probably less surprising.



While it would be nice to remove the git blame logic, this CL attempts

to touch as little as possible to first prove this approach works.



Bug: chromium:1513729

Change-Id: Ie0e02b5a220d393eced4f80fa472cb15d387d357

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5218891

Commit-Queue: Titouan Rigoudy

Reviewed-by: Paul Semel

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1250902}

entry.title: Throw exceptions for malformed operations while layers are opened
entry.content:
Since layers are only filtered and composited into their parent bitmap

once the layer is closed, operations that access bitmap pixels are

malformed if there are layers open.



This can happen when reading the pixels from the canvas (for example

with `getImageData`) or directly overwriting pixels (with

`putImageData`).



With this change, exceptions are thrown for these operations when used

with open layers. Promises also fail in the case of `createImageBitmap`

and `convertToBlob`. Some APIs already had this behavior, but this CL

extends that logic to all APIs accessing bitmap pixels.



The existing tests for unclosed layers had to be moved to manual, since

for the offscreen and worker cases the generator uses methods that now

throw exceptions.



Bug: 1396372

Change-Id: I3e187c9ae4f68135219a6178adf079616c470f9b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5075139

Reviewed-by: Jean-Philippe Gravel

Commit-Queue: Andres Ricardo Perez Rojas

Reviewed-by: Aaron Krajeski

entry.title: [macOS] Further improve test coverage for BookmarkMenuCocoaController
entry.content:
This patch adds test coverage for the codepath where BookmarkModel

isn't loaded when the controller is exercised to open a bookmark. It

increases the file's absolute test coverage from 59% to 74%,

unblocking future changes without having to use an exemption via

Low-Coverage-Reason.



Based on code history, it appears that this scenario is reachable

during the zero-profile state, see https://crbug.com/1332984.



Mimic-ing a relistic zero-profile state is hard, so this patch instead

exposes a test-only API in the controller to open a bookmark given its

identifier, and uses SetTestingFactory() APIs to, somewhat

questionably, replace the profile's BookmarkModel instance with a new

one that hasn't completed loading.



Bug: 1446243

Change-Id: I91dad8c6ff7a32b881faff3b6654164f6f798cd0

entry.title: Record early-boot field trials on file creation
entry.content:
featured.FieldTrialEarlyBoot.inactive_trial fails on certain boards and

models due to a race condition if run after

featured.FieldTrialEarlyBoot.active_trial.



Add logic to only record early-boot field trials if the trial file was

created. We do not want to record early-boot field trials if the file is

deleted, modified, or moved.



Tested by leasing an affected board (kano) and manually verifying that

the test passes consistenly with the change.



BUG=b:313473373

entry.title: Sync prefs: Make kIOSChromeSyncablePrefsAllowlist constexpr
entry.content:
Before this CL, kIOSChromeSyncablePrefsAllowlist was created via

MakeFixedFlatMapNonConsteval, which is discouraged since it does

sorting at runtime. Instead, MakeFixedFlatMap should be used which

does the sorting at compile time, but requires all the inputs to be

constexpr.

This CL updates all the relevant pref definitions to `inline constexpr`,

which allows `MakeFixedFlatMap` to be used. (It's also arguably

preferable anyway - the pref definitions are now all in one place, the

header, rather than split across .h and .cc/.mm.)

entry.title: [DoH] Extend DoH metrics
entry.content:
Extends the expiration date of most DoH metrics that haven't

been automatically extended.



The Net.DNS.ResolveContext.DohAutoupgrade.Status is planned to

replace some of the older metrics like the following:

- Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureNotValidated.FailureTime

- Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureNotValidated.SuccessTime

- Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.NetworkChange.Success.AttemptTime

- Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.NetworkChange.Failure.AttemptTime

- Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.ConfigChange.Success.AttemptTime

- Net.DNS.ProbeSequence.ConfigChange.Failure.AttemptTime



It seems like it isn't working entirely as expected, though, as

we aren't seeing any "FailureWithSomePriorSuccesses" reports...

I'm going to extend all of these metrics by six months while I

investigate this.



We intend to keep

Net.DNS.DnsTransaction.SecureNotValidated.FailureError long-term,

so extending it for one year.

entry.title: base: add java.nio.Buffer -> span<uint8_t> conversions
entry.content:
This CL adds four new conversion functions:



base::android::JavaByteBufferToSpan

base::android::JavaByteBufferToMutableSpan



base::android::MaybeJavaByteBufferToSpan

base::android::MaybeJavaByteBufferToMutableSpan



which take a JNIEnv and a jobject (which should correspond to a

java.nio.Buffer) and return a matching base::span.



This is desirable because there are error cases for this conversion:

* If the passed jobject is not a java.nio.Buffer, or the buffer is not

aligned and the platform requires aligned access, the

JNIEnv::GetDirectBufferAddress() can return nullptr;

* In the same situations, JNIEnv::GetDirectBufferCapacity() can return

-1 (!)



Very few of the users of these functions remember to check for these, so

this change wraps them up behind a safe interface and migrates some of

those users.



Bug: 1515667

Change-Id: Idbf1a96857dd2b866852fdb5c198f64f32340223

entry.title: [ios] Autofill Across iframes: Move Agent logic to Driver
entry.content:
Compared to the Content implementation, the iOS AutofillAgent does a lot

more work. This CL moves logic into the Driver, so that it more closely

mirrors both the Content version and the Router with which it will

interface.



My intention is that this CL has no behavior change. A follow-up CL will

wrap the logic in these (plus a few other) driver methods and use them

as callbacks for the AutofillDriverRouter.



I did a bit of a diff between ContentAutofillDriver, AutofillDriverIOS,

and AutofillDriverRouter to inform these and future changes, which may

be useful context for reviewing. You can see and comment on that here

(Googlers only):

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10a9A_HJj5eC-g4HzTYAGfUYQ52vqKBo69Q7Bf4nfh8Q/edit#gid=0



Bug: 1441921

entry.title: Split PaymentsDataCleaner from PDMCleaner
entry.content:
PDMCleaner is responsible performing cleanups like disused address/

credit card deletion and deduplications. This logic is called by the PDM

after initialization.



This CL splits all payments-related logic into a separate

PaymentsDataCleaner class, which is moved into the payments/ folder.

A follow-up CL will rename PDMCleaner to AddressDataCleaner.



The code is moved 1:1, modulo the necessary renames and removal of

unused imports.

entry.title: Replace std::optional<ThirdPartyBlockingScope> with a bool
entry.content:
The key insight is that only one value of the ThirdPartyBlockingScope

enum is ever constructed. Thus, std::optional

is equivalent to a bool. This CL replaces it with a bool that represents

whether partitioned cookies are allowed. I personally find the positive

"is allowed" logic easier to follow.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Implement main logic to decide whether the module is shown.
entry.content:
This CL updates the decision logic in



TabResumptionModuleUtils.shouldShowTabResumptionModule()



to return true if (1) it's enabled by flag, (2) user is signed in, (3)

sync is enabled. TODOs are left for metric collection. Note that the

check decides whether to *attempt* to show the TRM. If there isn't

enough good suggestions, the attempt can still fail, with the TRM not

shown.



Also add TabResumptionModuleUtilsUnitTest back, with 2 tests.



Bug: 1515325

entry.title: Revert "Reland^3 "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default""
entry.content:
This reverts commit a1d5b0e6793839d079b3497268b10157ac02219e.



Reason for revert: Broke Cronet's ARM64 bot (https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-cronet-arm64-rel/118013/overview)



Original change's description:

> Reland^3 "android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default"

>

> This reverts commit 58b4a751dbb46c62d2874e507417f5a9a1f63452.

>

> Reason for revert: Added pgo to failing bots (separate commits)

>

>

> > > Original change's description:

> > > > android: Make arm64 builds HighEnd by default

> > > >

> > > > The most popular arm64 builds (Trichrome) are shipping with

> > > > is_high_end_android. The Monochrome arm64 builds are shipped for old

> > > > devices, and we expect these to gradually become less popular.

> > > >

> > > > This change sets is_high_end_android to true for arm64 builds by

> > > > default.

> > > >

> > > > This would make local benchmarking slightly less error prone because

> > > > there would be a little less to remember to set in GN args when making a

> > > > build for the most popular official configuration.

> > > >

> > > > Known effects:

> > > >

> > > > 1. Seemingly all official arm64 builders now explicitly set

> > > > is_high_end_android. Hence no effect for them.

> > > >

> > > > 2. Non-official arm64 builders will change to become high-end, even the

> > > > ones that end up running on old devices (example: android-arm64-rel).

> > > > In this patch we make sure that is_high_end_android is ignored for

> > > > non-official builds (disabled RELR relocations for non-official).

> > > > Hence, no effect here as well.

> > > >

> > > > 3. Official builds of Monochrome made by devs would fail to run on

> > > > Android pre-P (because RELR support is lacking). This leads to

> > > > mysterious crashes during something-dlopen in the Android dynamic

> > > > linker. Hopefully nobody does this before we remove support for

> > > > Android O.

> > > >

> > > > Bug: 1515925

> > > > Change-Id: I695c98852bb410894144452211aa06cc32ffb141

> > > > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5169071

entry.title: [CSC] Require that the capturer be focused
entry.content:
In the long-term, it is envisioned that Captured Surface Control APIs

should be callable from an unfocused capturing tab, so that video

conferencing apps would be able to delegate scrolling to a remote

participant. However, this requires careful handling of competing input

from the local user, if they are interacting with the captured tab, and

the app using CSC APIs. For the time being, such a mechanism has not yet

been decided upon, and so we impose the much stricter requirement of the

capturing tab being focused, which implies that the captured tab is

unfocused, and is not receiving the local user's competing input.



Bug: 1520858, 1466247

Change-Id: Ia3c6068ed8857b76e892be464152c2e394a3ab6b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224406

entry.title: [Hub] HubLayout use a SolidColorSceneLayer rather than an empty layer
entry.content:
Rather than using an empty SceneLayer that will show a white background

always, use a SolidColorSceneLayer. This allows us to match the

composited background color to the Hub background. During orientation

changes or other events where the Android UI might go away, this will

prevent the background from flashing white.



Bug: 1487209, 1520657

entry.title: [Hub] Skip fade animation for Start Surface
entry.content:
Skip fade animations for transitioning between Hub and Start Surface.

This is the same as the pre-Hub transition behavior and is necessary

due to the fact Start Surface's layout immediately hides or becomes

visible on the layout transition finishing so there is no opportunity

for a smooth crossfade (which is difficult to coordinate due to how

LayoutManager works).



Also skip the animation if the animate flag is set to false in show().



If show NTP on startup launches we hopefully won't have this issue

anymore. This seems like the "cheapest" fix in the interim.



Bug: 1520657

applying change in [1] on top of M119 (Android N cut-off branch) with

killswitch enabled fixes the issue. Change in [1] switches to using

thread. Considering change [1] has shipped for quite some time, this

change enables RasterInterfaceInVideoResourceUpdater flag for Android

as well.

entry.title: Use public PDM API in PDMCleaner
entry.content:
PDMCleaner currently calls the private (Update|Remove)ProfileFromDB()

functions and befriends the PDM for this reason. This CL instead:

- Makes RemoveProfileFromDB() public and renames it to RemoveProfile(),

matching the existing (Add|Update)Profile() functions.

- Calls UpdateProfile() instead of UpdateProfileFromDB() in the

PDMCleaner. UpdateProfile() internally calls UpdateProfileFromDB(),

but also performs some sanity checks, such as "if the profile is

empty, remove it instead", "if it's an exact duplicate of something

else, remove it instead".



The friend declaration cannot be removed just yet, since the credit

card deduplication code contains a reference to the private

GetLocalDatabase().



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: Ib394642107030cc8dc50db7fb163f7c4e5a324a0

entry.title: Reland "Lazily create the TextureLayer for WebGPU"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 914cc2432e9c6a2ffc40fad894dcd6b6fe3ba93b



This reland adds a SetNeedsCompositingUpdate notification to the

GPUCanvasContext's host when TextureLayer is created.



Original change's description:

> Lazily create the TextureLayer for WebGPU

>

> If the TextureLayer of canvas already created, its background color

> will be drawn to the layer. But if TextureLayer has no texture, this

> layer can not be composited. This CL delays creating TextureLayer for

> WebGPU until GetNewTexture, ensuring TextureLayer can be composited.

>

> Bug: 1516905

> Change-Id: I957d0e2d5a026933cd36e82dea96d83ae9d034a6

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5196366

entry.title: Add NotCondition to components/enterprise/data_controls
entry.content:
This CL adds support for the "not" key in DC rules. A few assumptions

are made on the schema of the value passed to `Rule::GetCondition`

(see comments), but otherwise its implementation is not very complex

and it follows the same patterns as other Condition sub-classes.



This CL also refactors `AndCondition` to have more `const` types

in its methods to be compatible with `NotCondition` and `OrCondition`.

entry.title: Make credit card cleanups independent from sync
entry.content:
The PDMCleaner performs disused card deletion and clears non-settings

origins. Both of these operations only operate on local cards, which are

not synced. There's thus no reason why the code should wait for sync to

be ready. In fact, due to crbug.com/1517515 waiting for sync is

currently broken, so making the logic independent from sync fixes this

issue for cards.



To do so, this CL:

- Renames CleanupData() -> MaybeCleanupAddressData()

- Renames ApplyAddressAndCardFixesAndCleanups() ->

MaybeCleanupAddressDataAfterSyncChange()

- Renames ApplyDedupingRoutine() -> ApplyAddressDedupingRoutine()

- Renames ApplyCardFixesAndCleanups() -> CleanupCreditCardData(),

makes it public and calls it after the PDM initialization is complete.

- Removes is_credit_card_cleanup_pending_. This check is no longer

necessary, since the function is only called from a single place,

which itself already checks that it's only triggered once.



Bug: 1517515

Change-Id: Id2a07b6b14d3c427c8445f5861346d98c7130d96

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5224728

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1250776}

entry.title: Rename //net/base/mac directory to //net/base/apple (3/n)
entry.content:
This renames the remaining directory in //net/base used both by macOS

and iOS, following the naming convention and changing it something more

suggestive.



Like suggested by mark@, this renaming process will be carried on in

three steps:



1. Rename net/base/mac to net/base/apple, creating new temporary

forwarding headers in net/base/mac that #include net/base/apple.



2. Convert all of the use sites from net/base/mac to net/base/apple.

This can be done across multiple ch anges if desirable, which could make

things more manageable for reviewers. The changes here are performing

this step in //components, //content and //ios/components directories,

using the following command:

LC_CTYPE=C find . -type f -exec sed -i "" "s:net/base/mac/:net/base/apple/:g" {} \;



3. Remove the temporary forwarding headers in net/base/mac, so that

we‚Äôre only left with net/base/apple.



Bug: 1519486

Change-Id: Ic9b8e9fac3277ebfef31507d4ebe226787aeb43b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5216956

Commit-Queue: Tiago Vignatti

Reviewed-by: Sylvain Defresne

Reviewed-by: Kenichi Ishibashi

entry.content:
libstdc++ equality checks in static assertion that it is possible to

compare for equality base::Uuid to BookmarkNode*. This was a missing

operator in NodeUuidEquality that this changeset adds.

entry.title: Enable render-blocking inline module scripts
entry.content:
Inline module scripts need to behave like scripts with `src` in many

ways, e.g. if they have imports. Otherwise authors have to use a

fake `src` for artificial reasons.



This implements the spec PR:

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10035



Currently behind a flag (RenderBlockingInlineModuleScript)



Bug: 1514881

Change-Id: I8579d721adbf976a1d5e20d14abc6ef7252b0718

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5184455

Commit-Queue: Noam Rosenthal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1250749}

entry.title: Instantiate AccountManagedStatusFinder in PDM on sync state changes.
entry.content:
The finder provides the account status, which is required for

calculating the Autofill sync toggle visibility. This is

a temporary soution until the toggle becomes available on

the Sync page.

Note the solution is not perfect as the status retrieval is

an async operation, while in PDM the toggle visibility calculation

is synchronous. The status retrieval is initiated when the sync

service changes and it is assumed that there will be enough time

to get the response by the time it is required on the Autofill page.



Bug: 1503058

Change-Id: I6eb8444a39751b33928348800a7873d7635f4a53

entry.title: Check GpuChannel thread consistency
entry.content:
GpuChannelManager::RemoveChannel() can be called on the wrong thread,

causing the UAF of GpuChannel object during thread racing. Avoid further

wrong-thread accesses by the sequence hard check.
